etymology.type: Phono-semantic compound ( 形聲 / 形声 , OC *doŋ, *doŋʔ, *doŋs ) and ideogrammic compound ( 會意 / 会意 )
etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "man") + 東(東) (dōng, "bag") = a man carrying a bag -> 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") added to show the bag-carrying man is on the ground -> current form shows heaviness
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the meaning of a person carrying a burden or bag, emphasizing the weight (heavy) of the load, with the semantic reinforcement of standing on the ground. This visually conveys the idea of heaviness.

examples.chinese: 这个箱子很重(這個箱子很重)。
我挑水井水时(我挑水井水時)，感觉瓶子异常重(感覺瓶子異常重)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ tiāo shuǐjǐng shuǐ shí, gǎnjué píngzi yìcháng zhòng.
examples.english: While I was drawing water from the well, I felt that the bottle was unusually heavy.
